abstract: Exxon’s profit fell 68 percent in the third quarter, hurt by weakness at its production and development unit.
snippet: Exxon’s profit fell 68 percent in the third quarter, hurt by weakness at its production and development unit.
lead_paragraph: After posting record profits last year, major oil companies have struggled to adapt to a world of lower prices and slower economic growth. They have slashed costs, shed employees and pared high-cost investments made when prices were rising.

headline.main: Exxon’s Earnings Reflect Decline in Energy Prices
headline.print_headline: Oil Giants’ Profits Reflect Decline in Energy Prices
